p: Chemokines act as powerful chemoattractants which recruit inflammatory cells to migrate from the intravascular space across the endothelium and epithelium into the inflammation site, according to a chemokine gradient [ 33]. The role of one specific chemokine, CXCL10 (previously referred to as interferon-γ inducible protein of 10 kDa, or IP-10), has been highlighted in ARDS in both experimental models and in patients.
